channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2025030455
item.description:
Report X-2025030455

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that he had just clocked in when one of his checkers came to report that a hazmat load that had been marked previously as damaged started leaking on the doc due to the pallet puncturing the bag. ABF Supervisor states that he wasn't around when it occurred but states that the pallet looked like it got punctured by some of the wood on the pallet.

item.title: Report E-2025030094
item.description:
Report E-2025030094

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: FINDLAY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 5, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum was punctured and released approximately 25-gallons to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site and containerized all impacted materials in two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum of product was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025030084
item.description:
Report E-2025030084

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 4, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove all the released paint. The damaged pail and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025030065
item.description:
Report E-2025030065

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-04
  • City: TOLEDO
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8’-by-10’ area They estimated that twenty-five (25) ounces of material were released due to manufacturer packaging being poorly sealed on the product bags. There were four impacted bags during the release. Hepaco personnel used a HEPA filtered shop vacuum to clean up the material. The vacuumed material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with the 4 damaged bags and PPE. The undamaged bags in the shipment were restacked and shrink-wrapped to ship on. Hepaco personnel staged the generated waste onsite before departing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2025030215

  • City: VANDALIA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the INDH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single plastic container in a plastic bag. the container had a small puncture on the bottom causing the release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025030170
item.description:
Report X-2025030170

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-11
  • City: ATTICA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3600000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: NS train 18ML811 pulling east on Main #1 near Attica, OH derailed 20 cars. The derailment led to the release of 5800 gallons of "alcohols, n.o.s." from tank car TILX360188 due to 2 manway bolts being sheared off and the release of 20 gallons of alcohols, "n.o.s." from tank car TILX198831 from the closed BOV after the BOV nipple was sheared off. The total cost for both releases will be recorded on this report for TILX360188. The total cost estimate is $3,600,00.

item.title: Report E-2025030152
item.description:
Report E-2025030152

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-10
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0203 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at the terminal XCO It was reported that 2 ounces of “CHLORO” UN3266 were from two 55-gallon DF plastic drums. The release impacted the drum lids. ERTS has requested the SDS from CANUTEC (Emergency Contact for the Shipper). The terminal personnel cannot clean the release with the Corrosive 8 policy. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-ounces of UN3266 Chloro product released due to the bung caps being loose, one was replaced, and rest of the drums were tightened. No waste was generated.
